comment: This was my second time taking her. She is a tough grader but once you understand her expectations passing is very easy. She is very kind and passionate about her classes. I really liked her but some would say she is an acquired taste. I would 100% take her for a third time if I could. Just put in the effort, do the homework and you will be fine.

Do not take !!!! I would highly recommend changing professors AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. She grades extremely hard and grades test completely different depending on the student. She does not explain material well. If you want to be confused throughout the semester I would suggest to pick another professor.

Professor Miller was great. I enjoyed her class material. Homework are completion grades, so do them to get more points! There was 4 assessments in my class, i did not do the best on them and did a lot better on the final to receive an A in the course. Taking notes in class helped me more than anything! There are many times we used the textbook!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Although I received an A in the class, I really had to work for my grade. She is a tough grader when it comes to exams, they're take home. If you have the right answer but a bad explanation then its wrong. She gives homework once a week. Take advantage of the SDL opportunities they'll help your grade a lot!

had her for 3316 and 17, 3316 was very difficult with her but manageable. All tests are take home and open note. She is very educated, therefore, is great at teaching. Homework due once a week, but grades for completion. take her if you can! She is so sweet and always tries to make class fun and interactive
Dr. Miller was a great professor. She makes sure you understand before moving on. She is a very hard grader on tests. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE SDL OPPERTUNITIES

Dr. Miller is a really sweet professor. I'm not sure why her ratings are so bad but she is really caring and she's there to help you if you need help. She can be a tough grader but because of the situation we were in this semester it was really hard not to get an A in the class because she had lots of extra credit opportunities. She's really good!

I would prefer any other professor at KSU. I have gotten lower grades before with other professors but I would still rather take them. She graded things extremely tough, for me at least and many other students. But she seemed to pick certain students to take it easy on. Terrible personality, wasted the first hour of every lecture, and rude!

Worst math professor at KSU! Some of these reviews are positive, and that makes sense because she is so inconsistent. One day she will grade you normally and the next she will take off point for things that make no sense. It was so bad that she would take off point for things she did herself. She also would grade each student differentlyDO NOT TAKE

She is so inconsistent. She will explain a problem one-way but when you do that on homework or a test she takes points saying you shouldn't do it that way. She also would grade each student differently. Even when multiple students had identical math work, she would somehow give some people a 80 and some a 70. She picks and chooses with students.
not understanding, extremely tough grader, do NOT take this professor
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Miller is so caring and you will leave her class inspired about all things Geometry. You will get to do 3 self directed learning projects (SDL) and this really helps foster concepts.
She is very nice! She isnt too hard and she is very understanding. Her second exam was really hard, but I would definitely recommend her! I had her during COVID and shes great online as well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm still so confused as to why Dr. M has such a bad reputation. I was TERRIFIED at the beginning of the semester because of her reputation on here alone. But, I honestly thought she was wonderful and I hate math, so that says a lot. If you're someone that skips a lot of class, then yeah, you're not gonna like her. Show up -- get an A or B.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't really like the way she teaches. If you struggle with math and you ask questions then she will treat you like you're stupid.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Miller has a tough reputation but dont believe everything you hear. She wants her student to succeed and makes sure you have the conceptual understanding of the why to the what! She is very clear in her grading and tries to give you the benefit of the doubt. Offers partial credit on tests. Overall, she is a great professor!

She is very nice and caring. She really isnt that bad, and genuinely tries to help. She has 3 tests and a quiz every week. She grades kinda hard and is very specific with what she is looking for. Shes very personable so if you need to talk to her, dont be afraid to. Overall this class is possible, you just need to put in the effort as well

Professor Miller is very nice and caring about her students. She is very flexible and understanding. I like her as a person a lot, but i HATE the aleks system. It teaches nothing compared to what is on the tests, and it is so much work. She lets you have a note card for every test though and they're all 11 questions. Basically aleks just sucks.

I personally would not take her class again. She gives pop quizzes, that if you arent in class to take then, oh well. she is very nice and you're able to talk to her during her office hours. However, her test are very hard and confusing. She words her test questions extremely hard. If do not have to take her DONT.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Exams do not match what we learned. Good office hours & extra credit. HW everynight. Very hard exams and quizzes. Very tough grader. Most people received a C in my class. Very nice outside of class. Dont take if you think its going to be an easy class. Hardest class i have ever taken at KSU.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. M is a tough teacher and makes you work for every point. She is good at explaining general concepts but when I asked her to provide more explicit instruction she essentially guided me to make self-discoveries (which were sometimes wrong), so I ended up having to teach myself a lot. She gives extra credit opportunities and has good office hours.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Gives so many quizzes out of nowhere and doesn't give students opportunities to prepare for them. She's a tough grader- she doesn't change her instruction even though many students fail all of her quizzes and tests. She has a super annoying personality. Do ALL the homework & review last class info before next class cause there'll probably be a quiz
good, take her
She's a good teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Miller is a great professor! I can say she is a little nit picky about some things but it is not something that you are not able to bear. I took it as a summer session so we had a lot to know at a time but it was not bad. She provides office hours so make sure you utilize them and not just right before a test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The tests are extremely different than the quizzes and her study guides do not reflect the tests at all. I am an A/B student and barley made a D in her class. Take a different professor if possible!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: WORST TEACHER! She isn't clear on what she wants on her test or what they are going to be on. She gives you study guides but they are from classes from years ago so it doesn't even match the test. Don't try emailing her because she won't email you back. If you are able to take any other teacher, DO IT! She isn't worth taking if you need the credit
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I see so many negative reviews on here & it's astounding. Dr. Miller is an EXCELLENT professor. Always willing to help her students learn. She's not a bad teacher. The content might be hard to grasp at first, but she's always willing to meet outside of class and work with you one-on-one or give individual feedback!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This class is confusing and the teacher is unclear about what she wants on tests or days she will be collecting homework. Do not take Mrs. Miller unless you absolutely have to, I would recommend anyone else but her. She is not the top teaching quality I expected from ksu.
Worst teacher of the semester! As a future teacher, I know that you know it, but can you get me to learn it is your goal. Just sad, come on KSU!

This is class is not easy by any means. Sometimes her instructions are unclear, which make things even more difficult. Dr. Miller makes you work for a good grade and she is a very tough grader. However, she is extremely knowledgeable about the material. She is always willing to help. There are quizzes every Friday.

This professor more than any other made me feel prepared to teach. I love the way she teaches and even though it is not a methods class she does teach you why and how you can use what she is teaching. Don't get me wrong, she is tough and she expects your best, but she is amazing!
Prof. Miller is tough, but she is a great teacher! If you want to be prepared to take the GACE, if you want to be ready to teach. TAKE HER!

I think no matter the professor the class would be tough. A lot of people rate her poorly, but I actually really liked her. If you just talk to her she's very willing to help. I won't lie, the tests are tough. Also she uses every second and then some for class. So don't schedule a class across campus unless you have ample time to get there.

It's unfortunate that professors such as this  care more about showing off the math skills  they learned while getting their  Ph.D.'s than actually teaching useful skills. The entire class was miserable  and learned nothing.   Useless class and professor.  Avoid at all cost and try another school.  KSU needs to get it together!

Worst math teacher I have ever had in college. She tells you to come to her office hours for help, but it doesn't help at all. She takes points off tests for the most minor things possible. Toughest grader. Tests are SUPER HARD. She acts like everyone in her class is a math major.... DO NOT TAKE HER if you can help it!!!!!

You either will love her or hate her. Don't expect to just go to class and get an A. You have to be ready to always be in class, paying attention, taking notes and practicing. You have to be able to prove what you do. Just getting the answer is not enough to get through this class. Be ready to work hard.  If you need help she will make time for you

I love math, and it's my best subject, so I didn't struggle as much as some of my classmates did, but I only learned through myself. This is the first B I have ever made in math and I have never worked so hard for it in my life. She is an extremely tough grader, and if your answer is not exactly right, it's wrong. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Dr. Miller is tough but fair. I really learned fractions this semester even if the tests were difficult.  I can honestly say I can teach fractions now. Thanks Dr. Miller!

Her tests are awful. I've made A's and B's in all my other math classes and I'm struggling just to get a C in Miller's class.  She takes off points for the littlest things on tests and if you don't work out a problem her way, expect to get points off. Don't take this mess of a class

Very ineffective teacher shows favoritism towards certain students there isn't enough time to complete the exams her lectures are not very clear I wouldn't recommend her to my dog that's just how bad she is do not take her if you want to pass

Quizzes every Friday, she drops a certain amount so that there are 10 total. Two tests & a final. Homework but not too much, do it because she'll check it every once in a while. Gave a free 100 to people who did the hw. Ask for help, she's very willing. 2 projects, easy 100 if you turn it in early for her to check. Wouldn't take again, confusing.

I am taking this class right now and it is by far the best Math course I have taken at University. I have always been terrible at Math and was very worried going into it. I love the different teaching approaches Dr. Miller takes and how she makes the course fun and interesting. Definitely recommend!!

I am taking this class right now and it is by far the best Math course I have taken at University. I have always been terrible at Math and was very worried going into it. I love the different teaching approaches Dr. Miller takes and how she makes the course fun and interesting. Definitely recommend!!

I do not like this professor. She is not clear during her lectures. I often felt that she was incapable of understanding her students and teaching them. There is also no structure in her class, which makes the tests really hard to complete! If you want to learn how to help your future students understand geometry please do not take this professor!!

This class was a waste of my time. For someone who struggles in math, TAKE ANYONE but her. If you're good with definitions (that really don't help) and Venn diagrams for HER learning style, then take her! She is a complainer and flat out shouldn't be a teacher. (She shouldn't give advice when she hasn't taught children EVER in her life)
